message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.MM, cs.AI, cs.NE 

The paper proposes a new approach for action recognition in videos using a learnable correlation operator to establish frame-to-frame matches over convolutional feature maps. This approach involves modeling both appearance and motion information, which are key components of computer vision and machine learning. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition). Additionally, the paper proposes a new architecture that enables the fusion of explicit temporal matching information with traditional appearance cues captured by 2D convolution, which involves learning from data and could be related to sub-categories such as cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). The paper also compares its approach with widely-used 3D CNNs for video modeling, which could be related to sub-categories such as cs.MM (Multimedia) and cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing).
